name: Perfumer's Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting a set of perfume bottles.

There are gardens known only to the perfumers. Whether hidden on the fringes of the highlands, or obscured by shadows inside caves, the flowers blossom in secret, waiting to impart their scent.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> of Perfume Arts, Perfumer's Bolt, and perfume bottle weapon attacks by 20% but does not enhance supportive perfume buffs.

name: Crimson Amber Medallion +3
caption:
A medallion with crimson amber inlaid.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

These medallions, of the largest variety, were conferred to Godwyn's inner circle of distinguished golden knights.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> by 10%.

name: Cerulean Amber Medallion +3
caption:
A medallion with cerulean amber inlaid.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

These medallions, of the largest variety, were conferred to Godwyn's inner circle of distinguished golden knights.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum FP</font> by 12.5%.

name: Viridian Amber Medallion +3
caption:
A medallion with viridian amber inlaid.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

These medallions, of the largest variety, were conferred to Godwyn's inner circle of distinguished golden knights.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum stamina</font> by 17%.

name: Two-Headed Turtle Talisman
caption:
A talisman in the shape of a two-headed green turtle.

Turtles are known as a nutritious ingredient, symbolic of inexhaustible power.

Two-headed turtles are a favorite subject in the land of the tower, due to the spiral shape of their intertwined necks.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">stamina regeneration</font> by 10 per second.

name: Stalwart Horn Charm +2
caption:
Ceremonial accoutrement worn by hornsent.

Horns are sublime artifacts to hornsent, and their presence confirms the belief that they are a chosen people.

Only the repeated sprouting of fresh horns can create a tangled horn, which is viewed as an irrefutable symbol of primacy.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">robustness</font> by 180.

<font color="#E0B985">Robustness:</font> Resistance to <font color="#C84343">blood loss</font> and <font color="#9DD7FB">frostbite</font>.

name: Immunizing Horn Charm +2
caption:
Ceremonial accoutrement worn by hornsent.

Horns are sublime artifacts to hornsent, and their presence confirms the belief that they are a chosen people.

Only the repeated sprouting of fresh horns can create a tangled horn, which is viewed as an irrefutable symbol of primacy.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">immunity</font> by 180.

<font color="#E0B985">Immunity:</font> Resistance to <font color="#40BF40">poison</font> and <font color="#EF7676">scarlet rot</font>.

name: Clarifying Horn Charm +2
caption:
Ceremonial accoutrement worn by hornsent.

Horns are sublime artifacts to hornsent, and their presence confirms the belief that they are a chosen people.

Only the repeated sprouting of fresh horns can create a tangled horn, which is viewed as an irrefutable symbol of primacy.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">focus</font> by 180.

<font color="#E0B985">Focus:</font> Resistance to <font color="#A698F4">sleep</font> and <font color="#EEAA2B">madness</font>.

name: Mottled Necklace +2
caption:
Vividly-colored ceremonial accoutrement worn by hornsent.

Horns are sublime artifacts to hornsent, and their presence confirms the belief that they are a chosen people.

Only the repeated sprouting of fresh horns can create a tangled horn, which is viewed as an irrefutable symbol of primacy.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">robustness</font>, <font color="#E0B985">immunity</font>, and <font color="#E0B985">focus</font> by 100.

<font color="#E0B985">Robustness:</font> Resistance to <font color="#C84343">blood loss</font> and <font color="#9DD7FB">frostbite</font>.
<font color="#E0B985">Immunity:</font> Resistance to <font color="#40BF40">poison</font> and <font color="#EF7676">scarlet rot</font>.
<font color="#E0B985">Focus:</font> Resistance to <font color="#A698F4">sleep</font> and <font color="#EEAA2B">madness</font>.

name: Spelldrake Talisman +3
caption:
Talisman with a large depiction of a blue ancient dragon.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#57DBCE">magic damage negation</font> by 22% (7% in PvP).

name: Flamedrake Talisman +3
caption:
Talisman with a large depiction of a red ancient dragon.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#F48C25">fire damage negation</font> by 22% (7% in PvP).

name: Boltdrake Talisman +3
caption:
Talisman with a large depiction of a yellow ancient dragon.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage negation</font> by 22% (7% in PvP).

name: Golden Braid
caption:
A braid of golden hair, cut loose.
Queen Marika's offering to the Grandmother.

What was her prayer? Her wish, her confession?
There is no one left to answer, and Marika never returned home again.
info: Increases <font color="#F5EB89">holy damage negation</font> by 22% (7% in PvP).

name: Pearldrake Talisman +3
caption:
Talisman with a large depiction of a pearlescent ancient dragon.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#57DBCE">magic damage negation</font>, <font color="#F48C25">fire damage negation</font>, <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage negation</font>, and <font color="#F5EB89">holy damage negation</font> by 11%.

name: Crimson Seed Talisman +1
caption:
A crimson-colored talisman patterned after an Erdtree seed.

The Erdtree seed of this talisman was presumed to be an object of myth. This age-old artifact also depicts the Two Fingers, perhaps harking back to the birth of the Erdtree.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">HP</font> restoration from the Flask of Crimson Tears by 30%.

name: Cerulean Seed Talisman +1
caption:
A cerulean-colored talisman patterned after an Erdtree seed.

The Erdtree seed of this talisman was presumed to be an object of myth. This age-old artifact also depicts the Two Fingers, perhaps harking back to the birth of the Erdtree.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> restoration from the Flask of Cerulean Tears by 30%.

name: Blessed Blue Dew Talisman
caption:
Talisman depicting the blessed boon that is a droplet of the blue, luminescent sap of the Erdtree.

It was once thought that the blessed sap of the Erdtree would drip from its boughs forever—but that age of plenty swiftly came to a close, and with time, the Erdtree became more an object of faith.
info: Restores 1 point of <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> every 2 seconds while equipped.

name: Fine Crucible Feather Talisman
caption:
A talisman fashioned from thin feathers that embody the aspects of various creatures.
Said to have grown on the human body long ago.

Hornsent view the Crucible as sacred for the refinement wrought through its evolutionary gifts. Most prominently, their tangled horns.
info: Grants 7 i-frames to backsteps (8 when holding an over-the-shoulder weapon) and sets backstep recovery to 12/10/21 frames at light/medium/heavy load while equipped, but increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage received</font> by 15%.

name: Outer God Heirloom
caption:
A talisman engraved with the lore of an outer god.

The clan, who lost everything in the great fires, peered upon the corpse of their ancestor, normally an act of sanctity, and saw in its shadow a twisted deity.

The clan had suffered such torment that the horrible thing was taken as an object of worship.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">arcane</font> by 5.

name: Shattered Stone Talisman
caption:
Shattered linchpin stone.

Linchpin stones are spiritual anchors said to hold the ground in place and quell the fury of earthquakes—when this one shattered, the surrounding town fell into the broken earth. One account claimed that the moon itself had come tumbling down.
info: Increases the potency of kicking and stomping attacks by 10%, affecting Dryleaf Whirlwind, Dryleaf Arts kicking attacks, Dane's Footwork kicking attacks, Deadly Dance's final kick, The <font color="#40BF40">Poison</font> Flower Blooms Twice, Hoarfrost Stomp, Divine Beast Frost Stomp, and Regal Roar altered heavy attacks of Axe of Godfrey, but does not affect Storm Kick.

name: Two-Handed Sword Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting a warrior two-handing a sword.

The horned warriors were fitting figureheads for the military might of the tower they kept watch over, their deft attacks slashing through any and all foes.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> of weapon attacks by 15% while two-handing a weapon.

name: Crusade Insignia
caption:
A talisman depicting a raised spear on a backdrop of flames, in remembrance of the lives lost in the sacred crusade led by Messmer.

The warriors who fought in the crusade set aside both honor and mercy to wantonly impale and scorch those deemed impure.

Those who felt invigorated by each cry of death were the same men who were certain of the sanctity of the campaign.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> by 15% for 20 seconds after defeating an enemy.

name: Aged One's Exultation
caption:
A talisman depicting the exultation of the aging untouchable, whose head resembles a sprig of ripe grapes.

"Gift your madness to our Lord.
Bless our brethren with grapes.
Take care that they fully ripen."
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage inflicted</font> by 20% for 30 seconds when <font color="#EEAA2B">madness</font> is triggered nearby.

name: Arrow's Soaring Sting Talisman
caption: A talisman composed of fletched and iron arrows.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> of arrows and bolts by 8% and increases the effective range of bows by 50%.

name: Pearl Shield Talisman
caption:
Talisman depicting a knight bearing a pearlescent greatshield.

The nature and the potential of impurity surpassed the understanding of the knights, and so they were forced to prepare for all threats known or unknown.
info: Increases <font color="#57DBCE">magic damage negation</font>, <font color="#F48C25">fire damage negation</font>, <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage negation</font>, and <font color="#F5EB89">holy damage negation</font> by 20% while guarding.

name: Dried Bouquet
caption:
A quaint bouquet of dried flowers, offered to a small grave.

The sorrow that flows from the untimely demise of a loved one is a tenderness shared by all, regardless of birthplace.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">attack power</font> by 20% for 30 seconds after a summoned spirit dies.

name: Smithing Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting an ancient smithing hammer.
Inscribed with a smithscript.

In ancient times, smithing was a divine act, and blacksmiths interpreted the script they perceived in the wrinkles of molten steel to imbue weapons with souls.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">weapon-throwing attack damage</font> by 10%.

name: Ailment Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting a soul taken by sickness.

When the weak were infected with the dreaded fly sickness, they perished well before the metamorphosis could take hold. Oddly, those who cared for the infected and made certain they were given a proper burial were never afflicted themselves.
info: Increases resistance to the most recently applied status effect by 350 for 120 seconds for <font color="#40BF40">Poison</font> and <font color="#EF7676">Scarlet Rot</font>, 45 seconds for <font color="#9DD7FB">Frostbite</font>, and 30 seconds for <font color="#C84343">Hemorrhage</font>, <font color="#A698F4">Sleep</font>, and <font color="#EEAA2B">Madness</font>; does not affect <font color="#A17945">Death Blight</font>.

name: Retaliatory Crossed-Tree
caption:
Handicraft depicting a golden crossed-tree.
One of the items conferred to the Needle Knights.

Long ago, the Needle Knights were in service of Miquella, but now they are no more. Save for one.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">attack power</font> of rolling and backstepping attacks by 17% (12% in PvP) but does not affect skill damage.

name: Lacerating Crossed-Tree
caption:
Handicraft depicting a golden crossed-tree.
One of the items conferred to the Needle Knights.

Long ago, the Needle Knights were in service of Miquella, but now they are no more. Save for one.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">attack power</font> of dash (running light and heavy) attacks by 15% (7.5% in PvP) but does not affect skill damage.

name: Sharpshot Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting an archer wielding a longbow.

The Albinauric archers were in a class of their own, and their deadly long-range specialists struck fear into the hearts of men.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">attack power</font> of arrows and bolts by 12% while aiming with the crosshair in first-person view, and increases <font color="#E0B985">attack power</font> of precision-aimed shots by 12%.

name: St. Trina's Smile
caption:
A talisman depicting a smiling St. Trina,
a vision conjured deep within a certain man's heart.

Engraved as a reminder of the unparalleled devotion of those who left their homelands to serve Rellana.

"By your leave, we will accompany you wherever your lunar vessel takes you."
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">attack power</font> by 20% for 30 seconds when <font color="#A698F4">sleep</font> occurs in the vicinity (12% in PvP).

name: Talisman of the Dread
caption:
Talisman depicting the dread dragon of the jagged peak, whose roars cause the peak's molten fury to boil and churn.

Bayle was the foul dragon's name—a terrible harbinger of destruction whose challenge to the ancient Dragonlord ended in grievous mutual injury.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">damage inflicted</font> by magma sorceries, incantations, and skills by 15%.

name: Enraged Divine Beast
caption:
A charm depicting the crazed, cavorting dance of the divine beast conducted at the tower festival.

Divine beasts are messengers of the heavens, and their rage mirrors the tumult of the skies, of which storms are the pinnacle.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">damage inflicted</font> by storm sorceries, incantations, and skills by 10%, affecting Divine Beast Tornado, Zamor Ice Storm, Storm Blade, Storm Assault, Storm Stomp, Stormcaller, Thunderstorm, Storm Kick, Horn Calling: Storm, and Stormwing Bone Arrow.

name: Beloved Stardust
caption:
A talisman depicting a wizened hand gently gripping a glintstone.

Count Ymir was known for his recitations.

"One need only envision the romance of the stars above with adoration for stardust in one's heart to become a great sorcerer. Do so, and you will know love."
info: Shortens the casting time of sorceries and incantations by increasing <font color="#E0B985">casting speed</font> by 99, but increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage received</font> by 30%.

name: Talisman of Lord's Bestowal
caption:
A talisman depicting Godfrey, first Elden lord, receiving the precious sap.

The Lord accepted the sap stoically, without any sign of wavering. No wonder Lord of the Erdtree casts a long shadow over the lands.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">poise</font> by 54% for 2 seconds after using a Flask of Tears.

name: Verdigris Discus
caption:
A discus made of verdigris, the corroded metal known for its heft.

Great weight makes for great strength. The strength to protect others.
info: Reduces damage taken by 10% while at heavy load and by 20% while overloaded (7.5% and 15% in PvP) but remains inactive at medium or light load.

name: Rellana's Cameo
caption:
Talisman featuring a gallant portrait of Rellana, the Twin Moon Knight.

Engraved as a reminder of the unparalleled devotion of those who left their homelands to serve Rellana.

"By your leave, we will accompany you wherever your lunar vessel takes you."
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">attack power</font> of stance weapon skills by 45% after holding the stance input for 1 second (red-glow activation), applying to Square Off, Overhead Stance, Wing Stance, Moon-and-Fire Stance, Night-and-Flame Stance, Unsheathe, and Transient Moonlight but not to bow skills.

name: Blade of Mercy
caption:
A thin, blood-stained dagger. No longer fit for use.

Hornsent employed this to honorably end the suffering of a compatriot. After claiming numerous lives, the dagger is now broken, but has acquired a spectral aura.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">attack power</font> by 20% for 20 seconds after landing a critical hit.

name: Talisman of All Crucibles
caption:
A giant mass of intermingling Crucible attributes.

Rumored to have sprouted upon giants and is known as the "mother of Crucibles" in ancient tower lore.
info: Grants the combined effects of all Crucible talismans, nullifies headshot bonus damage and prevents the headshot stagger animation, raises damage negations by 30% against critical attacks, and adds 3 i-frames to rolls and backsteps (does not stack with the Windy Crystal Tear) but increases all damage received by 45% at all times.
